Posts.Content: Jun 22, 2010 10:15AM nine_rugrats wrote: Well, i am enjoying the quiet and spending one on one time with my youngest daughter.  I get it again next month, they are going to 2 camps this summer.  I have grown sons who help me out and friends who beg me to let them help. And even tho i am new here the support here is amazing. i have a hard time asking for help, i have always done everything myself and its hard now that i can't. But i love my life out here on our farm and to me all the work is worth it.  Like today I got up and was in pain, but going out tending to the goats and chickens i felt better when i came in even tho i hadnt taken any pain meds yet.  If i didnt have the farm chores to do i wouldnt be very active at all.
Posts.Title: magnesium oil for bone pain... nine_rugrats nine_rugrats

Posts.Content: Jul 2, 2010 08:08AM nine_rugrats wrote: I also was recently dx with bone mets....too numerous to count.  And i know alot about pain in just the couple of months since this started.  Right now i feel like i am 90.  I havent walked normal in weeks.  I called the dr yesterday and got stronger pain meds.  At first i tried getting by without them cause i am a health nut and hate taking meds.  But it wasnt helping anything and i was so miserable.  So like everyone has been telling me...get the meds. What kind of treatment are you on?  I have learned that the treatments can make pain really bad.  I am sorry you are going thru this, but this is a great site.  I dont know what i would of done without the wonderful ladies here. Hugs, Tonya
Posts.Title: Recently diagnosed bone mets, very painful. Sheila8 cmhartley

Posts.Content: Jul 3, 2010 10:35AM nine_rugrats wrote: i also have a small effusion.  My dr said since i am doing chemo it could be caused by that.  He said not to worry much about it right now.  But mine is too small to even drain.  I know nothing about them tho, so i know i am not much help. I had a cough for a while and then it went away and i dont really have any shortness of breath.  So i dont know, he said it could just go away on its own.  I have a PET scan tuesday so i guess i will know more then. reading the posts tho now has me a lil worried
Posts.Title: Pleural Effusion Nanalinda angelsabove

Posts.Content: May 31, 2010 01:33PM nine_rugrats wrote: My dr said this is something i will be on at some point.  I am thinking that this is painting a pretty picture of my future...fat(i gained 20 lbs last time on chemo, and just now lost it all), bald, rash on my face and living in the bathroom.  My dr said that when you ger the rash you know its working.  And there is "some" diarrhea".  I said that i heard it was ALOT of diarrhea.  He laughed and said yeah, sometimes.  Does anyone not get the bad SE from tykerb?
